titleStmt.title: A treatise declaryng [and] shewig dyuers causes take[n] out of the holy scriptur[es] of the sente[n]ces of holy faders [and] of the decrees of deuout emperours, that pyctures [and] other ymages which were wont to be worshypped, ar i[n] no wise to be suffred in the temples or churches of Christen men. By the whiche treatise the reder that is indifferent, shall se and perceyue, how good and godly a dede it was of the senatoures of Arge[n]tine, that of late daies they caused all the ymages with their auters to be cleane take[n] out of their churches. The authours of this litle treatise ar the ope[n] preachers of Argte[n]yne.
Einigerlei Bild. English

notesStmt.note: Imprint from STC; W. Marshall appears in colophon.
Translated by William Marshall from the Latin translation by Jacobus Bedrote of Martin Bucer's Das einigerlei Bild.
Running title reads: That ymages nor pictures ought to be worshipped.
Another edition, with added appendix, of STC 24238, published in 1535.
Leaf G4 torn, with loss of print.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
